p: Using the 72 tested hyperparameter configurations of the full BRT model (ie, fitted using all available predictors), Supplementary Figures 1 and 2 show the out-of-sample predictive performance and the goodness-of-fit performance, respectively. Further analyses were based on the following optimal hyperparameters: data-partitioning ratio ( P = .65), tree complexity (tc = 27), learning rate (lr = 0.001), and bag fraction (bf = 0.75). In the simplified model we retained 24 survival predictors (out of the 43 originally included in the full model), accounting for 96% of the RI of the full model (ie, model with all candidate predictors).
